title: WI-1.6.19: Fix Discord command name

labels.name: incidence
labels.description: The system is broken or a functionality is failing.

labels.name: priority:low
labels.description: The priority of this issue is low

body:
### Description  
The Discord command `token_config` needs to be updated to `token_config_on_dm` to follow the current naming convention. This misalignment may cause confusion or inconsistency.

### Steps to Reproduce  
1. Use the command `token_config` in the Discord bot.  
2. Observe that the command works, but the name does not align with the updated convention.

### Expected Result  
The command should be named `token_config_on_dm` to reflect our naming standards.

### Current Result  
The command is still named `token_config` in the code.

### Additional Information (Optional)  
- The issue is located in `discordbot/src/commands/token_commands.py`.  
- Update all occurrences of the old command name in the project to avoid inconsistencies.

labels.name: state: to-do

body:
Description: When datasets command are called with an empty response (no datasets provided) an error is produced as the list used to show the data exceeds the range. 

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new account on UVLHub so there is no datasets associated.
2. Generate API token on UVLHub.
3. Config bot to save token with !token command.
4. Call the !datasets command,

Expected result: The response must be a message that says no datasets was found.

Current result: An unexpected error occurred (list index out of range)

Additional information:

title: Create unit test suite for dataset module

labels.name: priority:medium
labels.description: The priority of this issue is medium

labels.name: state: to-do
labels.description: Task scheduled but not yet started

body:
**Description:**
The dataset module in the project lacks unit tests to verify its functionality and ensure its reliability. Unit tests are essential for detecting bugs early and ensuring that changes to the code do not introduce new issues.

**Expected Behavior:**
Unit tests should be implemented for all critical functions within the dataset module. These tests should cover various scenarios, such as successful creation of a dataset, validation errors, edge cases, and interactions with other components (e.g., the database or API).

**Actual Behavior:**
Currently, the dataset module lacks unit tests, which poses a risk for undetected issues in the code.

**Impact:**
- Increased risk of introducing bugs when modifying the dataset module.
- Lack of confidence in the stability of the module when making changes.

**Suggested Solution:**
- Include tests for:
  - Dataset creation and validation.
  - Handling of edge cases and error conditions.
  - Interactions with other components (e.g., database, API, etc.).

**Additional information:**
- Consider writing tests that mock dependencies or external systems to ensure the module can be tested in isolation.
- Review the existing code for areas that may require more detailed test coverage.

body:
Description:
The following workflows must be fixed: test, c1, deployment_on_webhook, deployment_on_dockerhub

- test.yml: contemplate discord bot
- ci1.yml: when merge from another branch is detected and has no conflicts, is done; when merge has conflicts, creates PR instead; if there is another PR open, launches error
- deployment_on_webhook/dockerhub.yml: are not used, should be removed
- render.yml: only activates when test.yml is successful

Steps to reproduce
When a commit is done, the corresponding workflow are activated, and launches errors.

Expected result:
These should not launch any error

Current result:
Launch errors

title: Create Team Journal Documentation

labels.name: priority:medium
labels.description: The priority of this issue is medium

labels.name: documentation
labels.description: Documentation for a part is missing

labels.name: state: to-do
labels.description: Task scheduled but not yet started

body:
**Description:**  
Develop a detailed and structured team journal page in the repository's wiki based on the format outlined in the [[Diario del Equipo](https://github.com/EGCETSII/Entregables/wiki/Diario-del-Equipo)](https://github.com/EGCETSII/Entregables/wiki/Diario-del-Equipo). The journal should document team activities, progress, and challenges throughout the project lifecycle.

**Steps (update constantly):**  

1. **Structure Creation:**  
   - Review the example provided to understand the structure and key elements required for the team journal.  
   - Create a template in the wiki with sections for dates, tasks, team members, and progress updates.  

2. **Content Organization:**  
   - Add entries documenting daily or weekly activities, including tasks completed, decisions made, and challenges faced.  
   - Include a section for upcoming tasks or blockers.  

3. **Formatting:**  
   - Use a consistent format for entries with clear headings, tables, or lists where necessary.  
   - Add timestamps and responsible team members for each entry.  

4. **Collaboration:**  
   - Ensure that all team members contribute updates to the journal regularly.  
   - Review entries for accuracy and completeness.  

5. **Publishing and Maintenance:**  
   - Publish the initial version of the team journal to the wiki.  
   - Update the journal regularly to reflect ongoing activities and progress.

title: Fill out Cover Page Template

labels.name: priority:medium
labels.description: The priority of this issue is medium

labels.name: documentation
labels.description: Documentation for a part is missing

body:
**Description:**  
Design and implement a cover page template in the repository's wiki based on the structure and guidelines provided in the [[Modelo de Portada](https://github.com/EGCETSII/Entregables/wiki/Modelo-de-portada)](https://github.com/EGCETSII/Entregables/wiki/Modelo-de-portada). 

**Steps:**  

1. **Template Analysis:**  
   - Review the provided model to understand the required elements, such as title, authors, version, and date.  

2. **Content Development:**  
   - Create a template including placeholders for:  
     - Project title.  
     - Team name and logo (if applicable).  
     - Deliverable title.  
     - Authors and contributors.  
     - Date of creation and last update.  
     - Version control information.  

3. **Formatting:**  
   - Ensure the layout is clean, professional, and consistent with the project's style guide.  
   - Use headings, alignment, and spacing to enhance readability.  

4. **Testing and Feedback:**  
   - Share the draft with the team for review and ensure all required elements are included.  
   - Incorporate feedback and finalize the template.  

5. **Publishing:**  
   - Upload the completed cover page template to the wiki.  
   - Include instructions on how to use the template for future deliverables.

WI-1.6.7: Discord does not accept messages longer than 2000 characters

labels.name: incidence
labels.description: The system is broken or a functionality is failing.

labels.name: priority:medium
labels.description: The priority of this issue is medium

body:
Description: Discord does not support messages longer than 2000 characters so in some commands as the one that lists datasets can produce errors if too many information needs to be displayed.
Steps to reproduce:

- Activate bot, configure user token and type !datasets.

Expected result: A dynamic  view must be implemented to support longer message in a way that the user can change between pages inside the message.

Current result: Implementation of embed messages that allows to send messages longer than 2000 characters and the use of buttons to navigate thrugh pages of data.
Additional information:

- Error: discord.ext.commands.errors.CommandInvokeError: Command raised an exception: HTTPException: 400 Bad Request (error code: 50035): Invalid Form Body
In content: Must be 2000 or fewer in length.

Codacy Implementation

labels.name: priority:low
labels.description: The priority of this issue is low

body:
**Description:**  
Integrate Codacy into the project to ensure compliance with the organization's Continuous Integration (CI) rules. 

**Steps:**  

1. **Set Up Codacy Integration:**  
   - Link the repository to Codacy.  
   - Configure the project in Codacy to begin tracking and analyzing the codebase.  

2. **CI Compliance Configuration:**  
   - Apply the organization’s standard CI rules in Codacy.  
   - Review and adjust Codacy settings to align with the project's specific needs.  

3. **Integrate Codacy with CI Pipelines:**  
   - Add Codacy checks to existing CI workflows.  
   - Ensure that Codacy automatically analyzes every pull request and commit.  

4. **Address Initial Issues:**  
   - Review the initial Codacy report.  
   - Fix high-priority issues or mark them for further discussion.

labels.name: priority:medium

title: WI-1.5.4: Add filter by size
body:
**Description:** To add more functionality to the advanced filtering task, we will develop a new filter to search for datasets that fall below a specified threshold.

**Process followed (update constantly):**
1. Add the dataset size filter to the Explore service.
2. Modify the Explore repository to include the filtering logic.
3. Update the Explore template to include the new component in the user interface.
4. Modify the script to handle user input related to dataset size and apply the filter.

**Modified modules:**
**- Explore:** Updated to include the new dataset size filter.

**Additional information:**
- Since the dataset size is not defined among the attributes, it was necessary to perform the filtering using a Python list instead of querying through the ORM.

title: WI-1.5.3: Add filter by date
body:
**Description:** To add more functionality to the advanced filtering task, we will develop a new filter to search for datasets by specifying a date (year, month and day are separately provided).

**Process followed (update constantly):**

1. Add the dataset date filter to the Explore service.
2. Modify the Explore repository to include the filtering logic.
3. Update the Explore template to include the new component in the user interface.
4. Modify the script to handle user input related to dataset date and apply the filter.

**Modified modules:**
**- Explore:** Updated to include the new dataset date filter.

**Description:** To ensure the reliability and quality of the application, we need to develop and implement a suite of tests. This will include unit tests, integration tests, Selenium tests, and Locust tests for performance and load testing. (Not every test type is required for every module, it will depend).

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Discord bot:
  - Install dpytest to test the bot.
  - Change logic to extract code from `__init__.py` files and relocate it to other files (`run.py` and `setup.py`).
  - Change how commands are added to the bot using a function that encompasses all commands, which is called in `setup.py`.
  - Modify how the test database is being used when testing. This also changes how the bot is being initiated in run.py.

**Expected result:** test running correctly.

**Current result:** all discord bot commands tested.

**Additional information:**

title: Implement Continuous Integration (CI)

labels.name: priority:critical
labels.description: The priority of this issue is critical

labels.name: incidence
labels.description: The system is broken or a functionality is failing.

body:
**Description:**  
We encountered challenges while implementing GitHub Actions workflows to integrate the **salmorejo-hub-1** repository's `main` branch with the **salmorejo-hub** repository's `develop` branch. The aim was to establish Continuous Integration (CI) to automate the process, ensuring consistency between the two branches.  

During the process, authentication issues were encountered, which delayed the setup. These issues need to be addressed to ensure seamless integration and prevent further delays in development workflows.

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Configure GitHub Actions workflows to automate integration.  
2. Attempt to push or create a pr to `salmorejo-hub-1/main`.  
3. Encounter authentication errors during the CI setup phase 403 forbidden.
4. Troubleshoot and resolve authentication issues.  
5. Test the integration process to confirm functionality.  

**Expected Result:**  
The `main` branch of **salmorejo-hub-1** is automatically merged into the `develop` branch of **salmorejo-hub** when no conflicts are detected. If conflicts arise, a notification should be sent to the user for manual resolution.  

---

UPDATE (28/11/2024):
Problem is solved and CI works.

title: feat: Implement remember my password feature. Closes #10
WI-1.2: Add Generate API token feature
body:
**Description:**  
As a developer, I want to implement a feature that allows users to generate API access tokens. This feature will enable users to securely create tokens for API usage with customizable expiration periods. JWT.io library will be used for this.

**Steps:**  
0. **Add SECRET_KEY_JWT to .env**

1. **Authentication and Access:**  
   - Ensure the user is authenticated (via login) and has access to the **API Configuration** page.  

2. **UI Implementation:**  
   - Add a section for **API Token Generation** in the **API Configuration** interface.  
   - Include input fields for specifying the token expiration period (e.g., number of days).  
   - Add a button labeled **Generate Token**.  

3. **Back-End Implementation:**  
   - Create an endpoint to handle token generation requests.  
   - Include logic for setting token expiration based on the input provided by the user.  

4. **Integration:**  
   - Connect the front-end UI with the back-end token generation endpoint.  
   - Display the generated token to the user upon success.  

5. **Validation and Error Handling:**  
   - Validate the expiration period input.  
   - Handle errors such as invalid input or back-end failures and display appropriate messages to the user.  

6. **Testing:**  
   - Verify token generation functionality end-to-end.  
   - Test for edge cases, such as unauthorized users or invalid expiration periods.  
   - Ensure that the token expiration logic works as intended.

title: WI-1.5: Advanced filtering feature
body:
**Description:** Add advanced filtering functionality to filter datasets based on a set of criteria or filters.

**Process followed:**

1. Add the new filters to the Explore service.
2. Modify the Explore repository to include the filtering logic.
3. Update the Explore template to include the new component in the user interface.
4. Modify the script to handle user input and apply the filter.
5. Update the Dataset seeder to include new data variations.

**Modified modules:**
**- Explore:** Updated to include the new dataset filters.
**- Dataset:** Updated to include new data variations.

title: WI-1.6.5: Add token configuration command
body:
Description: Implement a command that stores the token associated with a user to be able to use an API in UVLHub.

Process followed:

1. Create a command that redirects to a direct message if the user try to configure the token in a server for privacy purposes.
2. Create a command that saves in the database the tokes associated with the user that runs the command.
3. Tests both commands.

Modified modules: discordbot

Additional information:

title: WI-6.4: Add hello and help commands
body:
Description: Implement a command that says hello to see if the bot is correcty configured and another command that will show information about the bots commands.

Process followed:

1. Create command hello command.
2. Create help command.
3. Test command.

Modified modules: discordbot.

Additional information: help commands is not needed because discord.py already implements it.

title: WI-6.3: Configure bot prefix
body:
Description: Implement a command that changes the prefix used in each server or in each direct message with a user.

Process followed:

1. Configure access to uvlhub database.
2. Create a command that stores in the database the prefix and the id of the server/user.
3. Create a function that will be passed to the constructor of the bot in setup.py file that selects the prefix dynamically.

Modified modules: discordbot 

Additional information:

title: WI-1.6.2: Create discord bot account
body:
Description: Create a bot account in [discord](https://discord.com/developers).

Process followed:

1. Create account in discord.
2. Create a new application.
3. Configure name and profile image.
4. Create invitation link configuring the permissions

body: This PR adds two new commands to the Rosemary CLI: one to list all tables in the database, providing a quick overview of its structure, and another to display the first 5 rows of a specified table, allowing users to preview data content more easily.
